ETYMOLOGY: From Latin junctio ('act of joining'), from jungere ('to join').

MEANINGS.PATTERN: a junction [of A and B] | at a junction
MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A point where two or more roads, railway lines, or rivers meet or cross.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 两条或多条道路、铁路或河流交汇或交叉的地点。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The accident occurred at the busy junction near the city center.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 事故发生在市中心附近繁忙的交叉路口。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The act of joining, or the state of being joined; a place or point where things are joined.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 连接的行为或连接的状态；结合点或连接处。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The junction of the two pipes prevented any leakage.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 两根管道的连接处阻止了任何泄漏。
